Pre-Game Insights: England are in a three-way tussle for a place in the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup.
Skipper Jos Buttler will have the advantage of knowing exactly what they need to do in their final group match against Sri Lanka.
England are sandwiched between New Zealand and Australia on net run rate, though all three are level on points.
England opener Alex Hales expressed confidence in their skills and firepower to achieve the required victory margin.
England's net run rate looks 'pretty good' according to Alex Hales.
Openers have struggled in the tournament, but both Hales and Buttler smashed half-centuries against New Zealand.
England are favorites against Sri Lanka due to their deep batting and surfeit of all-rounders.
Sri Lanka's chances of making the semi-finals would require two upset victories – theirs against England and Afghanistan’s over defending champions Australia.
Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa stated that they aim to end their campaign on a winning note and justify their presence in Australia.
